newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh, Philippines sign joint-venture deals.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh, Philippines sign joint-venture deals.

text.p: Bangladesh and the Philippines on Thursday signed two agreements on joint ventures in infrastructure and computer training involving combined investment of around $500 million.
Both projects would be implemented in Bangladesh, officials said.
The lion's share of funding would be spent on a project to build and maintain roads, an official with the Philippines' Department of Trade and Industry said.
The other agreement was on joint operation of computer learning centres in Dhaka and the northeastern Bangladesh town of Sylhet.
The agreements were initialed on the second day of a three-day visit to Bangladesh by Philippine President Fidel Ramos.
Ramos and Bangladesh Industry Minister Tofael Ahmed witnessed the signing of the agreements between private companies of the two countries.
